word: And he's one of my favorite players. Although I thought the arrangement was a little trite.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: For his standard. And I thought that the tune was a little trite also. But, I thought his performance was very good. However they didn't get too good a sound on him. They got a little too much metallic and finger noises. So, I give it three stars, mainly because of Charlie. And he does play so very well.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: It's beautiful. I think that's Wes Montgomery and George Shearing. I know they did an album together. I have never heard anything from it. To my eyes, that's who it is.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: And, I think it's beautiful. I've got to give it four stars.

word: Who do you think composed it?

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: I don't know. I think George composed it. But it's well recorded and all the soloists come off beautifully. Wes Montgomery is definitely one of my favorite jazz guitarists. So, that's a four star.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Oh, fine.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: Wes and George think melodically similar, composing, not necessarily improvising.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: But, composing they think very similar.

word: Well, from that bass guitar, it's hard to tell who played it, because I don't particularly like the sound of it.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: I think it's Barney Kessel. The only reason I do think it's Barney, is because the arrangement sounds like Barney. And, a couple of the times the comping behind the soloist sounded like Barney.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: But that's the only way I could tell. Anyway, I think it's worth about two stars. If it is Barney, he also is one of my favorite players, but that's not one of my favorite-

word: You don't like the type of-

word: I don't like that type of record.

word: Yeah.

word: Well, I don't know. I don't know who it was. The bass player sounded very good. I like the bass player. And the tenor solo sounded good. The trumpet solo, he's a good player, but I though he's a little too obvious a copy, of Miles.

speaker: Leonard Feather
word: Yeah.

speaker: Herb Ellis
word: Not that that's not good, but I mean he's just copying a little too much on this particular record. Maybe he doesn't do that all the time. And the trombone didn't come off too well. The piano come off fair. It's a fairly nice little composition. I'd rate it three stars.

word: Otherwise, no particular comment on the composition?
